intro: Ulmaria glauca, commonly known as blue beadroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are tuberous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Ulmaria glauca thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in the understory of deciduous forests.
